intro: Meibomia guadalajarana, commonly known as the Guadalajara meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a slightly hairy texture. Meibomia guadalajarana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
